articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China Evergrande Group's (3333.HK) shares rose nearly 4% in early trading on Wednesday after their sharp recent declines.
articles.title: Evergrande shares rise despite mounting uncertainty over debt revamp plan

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Bank of Japan policymakers agreed on the need to maintain ultra-loose monetary settings but were divided on how soon the central bank could end negative interest rates, minutes of its July meeting showed on Wednesday.
articles.title: BOJ's July debate highlights rift in view on rate hike timing

articles.author: Byron Kaye
articles.description: Elon Musk's X, formerly called Twitter, disabled a feature that let users report misinformation about elections, a research organisation said on Wednesday, throwing fresh concern about false claims spreading just before major U.S. and Australian votes.
articles.title: Musk's X disabled feature for reporting electoral misinformation - researcher

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Profits at China's industrial firms extended a double-digit drop for the first eight months, but the pace of declines eased slightly as a flurry of policy support steps has started to stabilise parts of the stuttering economy.
articles.title: China's industrial profits extend slump for Jan-Aug, but pace of downturn eases

articles.author: Diane Bartz
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission filed a long-awaited antitrust lawsuit against Amazon.com (AMZN.O) on Tuesday and asked the court to consider forcing the online retailer to sell assets as the government accuses Big Tech of monopolizing the most lucrative parts of the internet.
articles.title: Amazon faces landmark monopoly lawsuit by FTC

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States has added three Chinese companies to the forced labor entity list involving Uyghurs, according to a government posting on Tuesday, as part of an effort to eliminate forced labor practices the U.S. supply chain.
articles.title: US adds three Chinese companies to forced labor entity list involving Uyghurs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Donald Trump and his family business were found liable for fraud on Tuesday in state Attorney General Letitia James' civil lawsuit accusing the former U.S. president of illegally inflating his assets and net worth.
articles.title: Trump is found liable for fraud in New York civil case

articles.author: David Morgan, Richard Cowan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The U.S. Senate on Tuesday was set to try to move forward on a bipartisan bill meant to stop the government from shutting down in just five days, while the House sought to push ahead with a conflicting measure backed only by Republicans.
articles.title: Dueling US Senate, House views on funding raise likelihood of government shutdown

articles.author: Simon Lewis, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: India's foreign minister, Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, said on Tuesday that India has told Canada it was open to looking into any "specific" or "relevant" information it provides on the killing of Sikh separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar.
articles.title: India would look into any 'specific' info on Sikh separatist killing in Canada-minister
